sections.title: Introduction to Yoga
sections.content: Yoga is an ancient practice that originated in India over 5,000 years ago. It combines physical postures, breathing techniques, and meditation to promote physical, mental, and spiritual well-being.
key_points: It's more than just physical exercise
Suitable for all ages and fitness levels

sections.title: Basic Yoga Poses
sections.content: These fundamental poses form the foundation of your yoga practice. Start with these to build strength, flexibility, and body awareness.

poses.name: Mountain Pose (Tadasana)
poses.description: Stand tall with feet together, arms at sides. Ground through your feet and lengthen your spine.
poses.benefits: Improves posture, strengthens thighs, knees, and ankles

poses.name: Tree Pose (Vrksasana)
poses.description: Stand on one leg, place the other foot on your inner thigh or calf, and bring hands to prayer position.
poses.benefits: Improves balance, strengthens legs and core

poses.name: Warrior I (Virabhadrasana I)
poses.description: Step one foot back, bend front knee, and raise arms overhead with palms facing each other.
poses.benefits: Strengthens legs, opens hips, builds stamina

poses.name: Child's Pose (Balasana)
poses.description: Kneel on the floor, sit back on your heels, and fold forward with arms extended.
poses.benefits: Relaxes the back, hips, and mind

poses.name: Downward-Facing Dog (Adho Mukha Svanasana)
poses.description: Start on hands and knees, lift hips up and back, forming an inverted V shape.
poses.benefits: Strengthens arms and legs, lengthens spine, improves circulation

sections.title: Breathing Techniques
sections.content: Breathing is the foundation of yoga practice. These techniques help calm the mind, reduce stress, and increase energy.

techniques.name: Ujjayi Breath
techniques.description: Breathe in and out through the nose, constricting the back of the throat to create a soft ocean-like sound.
techniques.benefits: Calms the mind, builds heat in the body
techniques.instructions: Inhale deeply through the nose, then exhale slowly through the nose while constricting the back of the throat

techniques.name: Box Breathing
techniques.description: Breathe in a square pattern: inhale, hold, exhale, hold, each for the same count.
techniques.instructions: Inhale for 4 counts, hold for 4 counts, exhale for 4 counts, hold for 4 counts

techniques.name: Alternate Nostril Breathing
techniques.description: Alternate breathing through each nostril while closing the other.
techniques.benefits: Balances energy, calms the nervous system
techniques.instructions: Close right nostril, inhale through left, close left, exhale through right, then reverse

sections.title: Yoga for Beginners
sections.content: Starting a yoga practice doesn't require special equipment or extensive training. Here are some tips to help you begin your journey.

tips.title: Start with the Basics
tips.content: Begin with simple poses and gradually progress to more challenging ones as your body becomes stronger and more flexible.

tips.title: Listen to Your Body
tips.content: Yoga should never cause pain. If a pose feels uncomfortable, modify it or skip it entirely.

tips.title: Focus on Your Breath
tips.content: Your breath is your guide. Breathe deeply and evenly throughout your practice.

tips.title: Be Consistent
tips.content: Even a short daily practice is more beneficial than occasional longer sessions.

tips.title: Use Props
tips.content: Blocks, straps, and blankets can help you achieve proper alignment and make poses more accessible.

sections.title: Yoga Etiquette
sections.content: Understanding basic yoga etiquette helps create a respectful and harmonious environment for everyone.
guidelines: Arrive on time or early to class
Remove your shoes before entering the studio
Stay for the entire class if possible
